newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's Vranitzky to resign Saturday - source.
newsitem.headline: Austria's Vranitzky to resign Saturday - source.

text.p: Austrian Chancellor Franz Vranitzky is likely to offer his resignation on Saturday, a senior source inside Vranitzky's Social Democratic Party said on Saturday.

"I would assume that this will happen," the source, speaking on condition of anonymity, told Reuters. Reports of Vranitzky's impending resignation in two Austrian dailies on Saturday were "not far from the truth", he added.
The source said Vranitzky, 59, had called a meeting of his party's executive committee at 4 p.m. (1500 GMT) on Saturday to offer his resignation.
According to reports in two leading Austrian dailies, Vranitzky was likely to be succeeded as chancellor and head of the Social Democrats by Finance Minister Viktor Klima, 49.
Vranitzky's spokesman Karl Krammer declined to comment on the reports. "There is no comment whatsoever from our side. I haven't even spoken to the chancellor myself," he said.
Vranitzky, a former banker and one-time professional basketball player who became chancellor in 1986, has repeatedly been reported to have become tired of politics.
